thread.title: Freezing rain and sleet set to hit parts of Michigan overnight
thread.title_full: Freezing rain and sleet set to hit parts of Michigan overnight

author: Eric Gaertner | egaertne@mlive.com
title: Freezing rain and sleet set to hit parts of Michigan overnight
text:
Freezing rain and sleet set to hit parts of Michigan overnight Thursday night freezing rain.png This graphic shows the area with the best chance for freezing rain in the overnight period in Michigan. Up to one-tenth of an inch of freezing rain is possible, according to the National Weather Service. (weatherbell.com) comments 
GRAND RAPIDS, MI - The morning commute on Friday, Feb. 24 could be rather slick in an area extending from Ludington to Fremont to Mount Pleasant. 
Based on the National Weather Service forecast, motorists in Northern Michigan could also be dealing with a slippery commute Friday morning. Freezing rain, like shown in this file photo, is part of a winter weather advisory issued by the National Weather Service for the overnight period. Tanya Moutzalias | MLive.com file 
Sleet and freezing rain are part of a winter weather advisory issued for the seven-county area extending from Lake Michigan to the middle of the state. The advisory is scheduled to run from midnight to 11 a.m. Friday. 
Untreated roads and sidewalks are expected to become icy overnight, according to the National Weather Service, which issued the advisory. Based on those conditions, the Friday morning commute in the advisory area is expected to be affected. 
Based on the advisory, the hazardous weather is set to start as light rain Thursday evening, and then it will change over to some sleet and freezing rain. Up to a tenth of an inch of freezing rain is likely in the areas north of M-20 in the advisory area. 
The National Weather Service forecast is calling for temperatures to warm above the freezing mark at some point Friday morning and all the precipitation will change to rain. 
Traverse City sets all-time February temperature record 
The winter weather advisory area includes Mason, Lake, Osceola, Clare, Newaygo, Mecosta and Isabella counties. 
Although not part of the advisory, the National Weather Service forecast also calls for a chance for up to a tenth of an inch of freezing rain for the northern Michigan counties extending north to the Mackinac Bridge.
